title: The City of Memphis says it has completed its investigation into Tyre Nichols' death
description: Nearly 20 hours of new footage and audio, along with accompanying documents, will be released to the public on Wednesday afternoon, officials say.

title: Railway transport safety is failing. These lawmakers have a plan to help
description: Another headline-grabbing trail derailment in the span of a month has legislators urging stricter safety regulations for railway workers.

title: Senate Republican Leader McConnell slams Fox and Tucker Carlson for Jan. 6 portrayal
description: McConnell joins U.S. Capitol Police Chief Tom Manger and Democrats in slamming Carlson's portrayal of the Jan. 6 attack. Carlson began a two-part show series on the insurrection Monday night.

title: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell warns inflation fight will be long and bumpy
description: Speaking before the Senate Banking Committee, Powell warned the central bank may have to raise interest rates even more, sending stock markets sharply lower.

title: Can insects have culture? Puzzle-solving bumblebees show it's possible
description: A new study in PLOS Biology finds that bumblebees can learn to solve puzzles from each other — suggesting that even invertebrate animals may have a capacity for 'culture.'

title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams is telling stores to have customers remove their face masks
description: "We are putting out a clear call to all of our shops: Do not allow people to enter the store without taking off their face mask," the mayor said. A flurry of questions ensued.

title: An explosion in Bangladesh's capital Dhaka kills 14 and injures more than 100
description: Firefighters are carrying victims out of the wreckage on stretchers. Officials are investigating the cause of the blast. Two other recent explosions were blamed on gas leaks.

title: DOJ sues to block JetBlue from buying Spirit Airlines, saying it will curb competition
description: The Biden administration sued on Tuesday to block the $3.8 billion purchase, saying the deal would reduce competition and drive up air fares for consumers.

title: A jet that experienced deadly turbulence may have had 'trim issues,' the NTSB says
description: Officials say the business jet may have experienced problems with its stability before it hit roughness that caused the death Dana Hyde, a passenger who served in prominent posts for two presidents.

title: Two Americans kidnapped in Mexico are found dead, two alive
description: The governor of the state of Tamaulipas, where the four Americans were kidnapped at gunpoint on Friday, said only two were found alive. Of them, one is injured.

title: California will cut ties with Walgreens over the company's plan to drop abortion pills
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom said that the state would halt business with Walgreens after the pharmacy giant agreed to stop distributing mifepristone in some red states amid legal pressure.

title: China is restructuring key government agencies to outcompete rivals in tech
description: China is proposing to overhaul its science, technology and finance regulators as part of a stiff competition with rivals while also tamping down risk at home.

title: Texas Women Sue Their State, Saying Abortion Bans Put Them in Danger
description: Those five plaintiffs, all of whom say they were put in danger by being denied abortions under Texas law, are asking a state judge to clarify exceptions for medical emergencies.

title: Biden says his budget plan would extend Medicare to 2050 without adding to the deficit
description: President Biden is proposing to raise taxes on people who make more than $400,000 per year to make sure there's enough money for Medicare.

title: Has the Republican Party abandoned the idea of limited government?
description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to former Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan, who announced over the weekend that he will not run for president in 2024, about the direction of the Republican Party.

title: Larry Hogan won't run for president, but has some advice for the Republicans who do
description: Former Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan announced over the weekend he will not run for president in 2024, but hopes to shape the future of the GOP. He talks to NPR about what he wants to see from his party.

title: China accuses U.S. of containment and warns of potential conflict
description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping's rare explicit criticism of the U.S. was followed on Tuesday by a barrage of scorn and criticism aimed squarely at Washington from China's new foreign minister.

title: What to know about the new U.N. high seas treaty — and the next steps for the accord
description: Right now, two-thirds of the ocean are regulated by a fragmented patchwork of agreements and organizations. This treaty plans to unite countries to improve the health of the ocean.

title: What SNAP recipients can expect as benefits shrink in March
description: Participants in the federal food program might want to reevaluate their eligibility level for SNAP — and consider other assistance programs — as a pandemic-era supplement ends this month.

title: 'Dr. No' is a delightfully escapist romp and an incisive sendup of espionage fiction
description: Pulitzer and Booker Prize finalist Percival Everett just won another prestigious award, the PEN/Jean Stein Award, for his newest book in which he makes a myriad of compelling creative choices.

title: A rundown of what's led to Atlanta's 'Cop City' protests
description: Police arrested at least 35 people after activists set heavy equipment on fire. Tensions have been building for years over the plan to build a large police training facility.

title: How (and why) this man plans to live underwater for 100 days
description: Retired Navy officer Joseph Dituri is attempting to break the world record for living underwater, all in the name of science.

title: How Barnes & Noble turned a page, expanding for the first time in years
description: After years on the brink, the bookseller is going for a plot twist: Sales are growing and the chain plans to open some 30 new stores. Here's what's changed.

title: Medical debt affects millions, and advocates push IRS, consumer agency for relief
description: More than 50 consumer and patient groups want the Biden Administration to aggressively protect Americans from medical bills and debt collectors. The effort follows a KHN/NPR investigation.

title: Q: Who's unsurprised by shocking Fox News revelations? A: Ex-Fox journalists
description: Evidence in Dominion Voting System's $1.6 billion defamation suit against Fox News has cast the network, its stars and its executives in a harsh light. Ex-Fox journalists say they're not surprised.

title: Tribes bury P-22, Southern California's famed mountain lion
description: The cougar's death set off a debate between tribes in the Los Angeles area and wildlife officials over whether scientists could keep samples of the animal's remains for future testing and research.

title: Canada announces a probe to examine possible Chinese election interference
description: The announcement of a probe of possible Chinese influence in Canadian elections follows a newspaper report stating that China preferred to see Trudeau's Liberals re-elected in the 2021 election.

title: A man allegedly stabbed a flight attendant, tampered with the plane on a Boston trip
description: The suspect was arrested at the Boston Logan International Airport after allegedly tampering with a side door and the emergency slide, and later allegedly lunged at a flight attendant.

title: The U.S. and Mexico are working together to find 4 Americans who were kidnapped
description: The abduction took place on the streets of Matamoros, Mexico. The FBI is offering a $50,000 reward for the return of the Americans and the arrests of those involved.
